name: LOC Documentation
description: User documentation for Logic Operating Centre (LOC) built on React-based Docusaurus 3
tooltip:
I was the creator and maintainer, including the Logic Code Generator tool I've developed on my own. The site in the link is actually a archived version deployed on Vercel. For the official version, please visit here.

The site includes a code template generator and unit test tool I've designed and developed on my own.

name: Svelte/Golang Full-Stack Demo App
description: A monolithic full-stack shopping demo app inspired by the book Essential TypeScript
tooltip: It gained more than 100 stars on Github after SvelteKit released v1.0.

name: Online TypeScript Editor
description: A simple online editor with IntelliSense support that can execute code directly in browser
tooltip: A similar Python editor can be found here, which supports several additional packages.

name: MicroPython Driver for TEA5767 FM Radio Module
description: An open-sourced radio driver utilizing most of the features documented in the datasheet
tooltip: A CircuitPython version is also available here.

name: SEFR Multiclass Classifier
description: The first multi-class classifier implementation based on SEFR, a fast linear-time binary classifier designed for training and running model on low-powered microcontrollers

name: MakeCode Editor Extension for Nexus:bit and NexusBot
description: A MakeCode editor extension (written in TypeScript) for controlling the micro:bit expansion board, Nexus:bit (a KittenBot Robot:bit clone) and Nexusbot (an OTTO robot-clone)
footnote: Taiwan Coding Education Association, Apr - Jul 2019
tooltip:
My former employer changed the author name to his after I left, however you can still find my name in the source code :p.

Fun fact: the extension also includes a long robot dance sequence based on the dance in the Japanese TV drama 'We married as a job!'.
